    • Method Detail

      • getPatterns

        public static List<int[]> getPatterns(int limit,
                      int size,
                      boolean weedOutRepeats)
        Calculate all the patterns of a given size up to a limit. Example: limit 3, size 2: 
             0 0 
     0 1 
     0 2 
     1 0 
     1 1 
     1 2 
     2 0 
     2 1 
     2 2
        Parameters:
        limit - the upper number of unique values.
        size - the length of each pattern.
        weedOutRepeats - remove patterns with consecutive values e.g. 0,0
        Returns:
        a List of integer arrays. Each array contains a pattern.

      • getPatterns

        public static List<int[]> getPatterns(int limit,
                      int size)

      • hasRepeats

        public static boolean hasRepeats(int[] a)
        Checks to determine if there are consecutive values. e.g. 0,0 1,1 2,2,2,2 etc.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        Returns:
        if there are repeats
